verses.text: These \add are\add* also \w proverbs|strong="H4912"\w* of \w Solomon|strong="H8010"\w*, which the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of \w Hezekiah|strong="H2396"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* copied \w out|strong="H6275"\w*.

\add It is\add* the \w glory|strong="H3519"\w* of \w God|strong="H0430"\w* to \w conceal|strong="H5641"\w* a \w thing|strong="H1697"\w*: but the \w honour|strong="H3519"\w* of \w kings|strong="H4428"\w* \add is\add* to search \w out|strong="H2713"\w* a \w matter|strong="H1697"\w*.

The \w heaven|strong="H8064"\w* for \w height|strong="H7312"\w*, and the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w* for \w depth|strong="H6011"\w*, and the \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* of \w kings|strong="H4428"\w* \add is\add* \w unsearchable|strong="H2714"\w*.\f + \fr 25.3 \ft is…: Heb. there is no searching\f*

Take \w away|strong="H1898"\w* the \w dross|strong="H5509"\w* from the \w silver|strong="H3701"\w*, and there shall come \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* a \w vessel|strong="H3627"\w* for the \w finer|strong="H6884"\w*.

Take \w away|strong="H1898"\w* the \w wicked|strong="H7563"\w* \add from\add* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and his \w throne|strong="H3678"\w* shall be \w established|strong="H3559"\w* in \w righteousness|strong="H6664"\w*.

Put not \w forth|strong="H1921"\w* thyself in the \w presence|strong="H6440"\w* of the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and \w stand|strong="H5975"\w* not in the \w place|strong="H4725"\w* of \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \add men:\add*\f + \fr 25.6 \ft Put…: Heb. Set not out thy glory\f*

For \w better|strong="H2896"\w* \add it is\add* that it be \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto thee, Come \w up|strong="H5927"\w* hither; than that thou shouldest be put \w lower|strong="H8213"\w* in the \w presence|strong="H6440"\w* of the \w prince|strong="H5081"\w* whom thine \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* have \w seen|strong="H7200"\w*.

Go not \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* \w hastily|strong="H4118"\w* to \w strive|strong="H7378"\w*, lest \add thou know not\add* what to \w do|strong="H6213"\w* in the \w end|strong="H0319"\w* thereof, when thy \w neighbour|strong="H7453"\w* hath put thee to \w shame|strong="H3637"\w*.

\w Debate|strong="H7378"\w* thy \w cause|strong="H7379"\w* with thy \w neighbour|strong="H7453"\w* \add himself;\add* and \w discover|strong="H1540"\w* not a \w secret|strong="H5475"\w* to \w another|strong="H0312"\w*:\f + \fr 25.9 \ft a secret…: or, the secret of\f*
Lest he that \w heareth|strong="H8085"\w* \add it\add* put thee to \w shame|strong="H2616"\w*, and thine \w infamy|strong="H1681"\w* turn not \w away|strong="H7725"\w*.

A \w word|strong="H1697"\w* \w fitly|strong="H0212"\w* \w spoken|strong="H1696"\w* \add is like\add* \w apples|strong="H8598"\w* of \w gold|strong="H2091"\w* in \w pictures|strong="H4906"\w* of \w silver|strong="H3701"\w*.\f + \fr 25.11 \ft fitly…: Heb. spoken upon his wheels\f*

\add As\add* an \w earring|strong="H5141"\w* of \w gold|strong="H2091"\w*, and an \w ornament|strong="H2481"\w* of fine \w gold|strong="H3800"\w*, \add so is\add* a \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* \w reprover|strong="H3198"\w* upon an \w obedient|strong="H8085"\w* \w ear|strong="H0241"\w*.

As the \w cold|strong="H6793"\w* of \w snow|strong="H7950"\w* in the \w time|strong="H3117"\w* of \w harvest|strong="H7105"\w*, \add so is\add* a \w faithful|strong="H0539"\w* \w messenger|strong="H6735"\w* to them that \w send|strong="H7971"\w* him: for he \w refresheth|strong="H7725"\w* the \w soul|strong="H5315"\w* of his \w masters|strong="H0113"\w*.

\w Whoso|strong="H0376"\w* \w boasteth|strong="H1984"\w* himself of a \w false|strong="H8267"\w* \w gift|strong="H4991"\w* \add is like\add* \w clouds|strong="H5387"\w* and \w wind|strong="H7307"\w* without \w rain|strong="H1653"\w*.\f + \fr 25.14 \ft of a…: Heb. in a gift of falsehood\f*

By \w long|strong="H0753"\w* \w forbearing|strong="H0639"\w* is a \w prince|strong="H7101"\w* \w persuaded|strong="H6601"\w*, and a \w soft|strong="H7390"\w* \w tongue|strong="H3956"\w* \w breaketh|strong="H7665"\w* the \w bone|strong="H1634"\w*.

Hast thou \w found|strong="H4672"\w* \w honey|strong="H1706"\w*? \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* so much as is \w sufficient|strong="H1767"\w* for thee, lest thou be \w filled|strong="H7646"\w* therewith, and \w vomit|strong="H6958"\w* it.

\w Withdraw|strong="H3365"\w* thy \w foot|strong="H7272"\w* from thy \w neighbour’s|strong="H7453"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*; lest he be \w weary|strong="H7646"\w* of thee, and \add so\add* \w hate|strong="H8130"\w* thee.\f + \fr 25.17 \ft Withdraw…: or, Let thy foot be seldom in\f*\f + \fr 25.17 \ft weary…: Heb. full of thee\f*

A \w man|strong="H0376"\w* that \w beareth|strong="H6030"\w* \w false|strong="H8267"\w* \w witness|strong="H5707"\w* against his \w neighbour|strong="H7453"\w* \add is\add* a \w maul|strong="H4650"\w*, and a \w sword|strong="H2719"\w*, and a \w sharp|strong="H8150"\w* \w arrow|strong="H2671"\w*.

\w Confidence|strong="H4009"\w* in an unfaithful \w man|strong="H0898"\w* in \w time|strong="H3117"\w* of \w trouble|strong="H6869"\w* \add is like\add* a \w broken|strong="H7465"\w* \w tooth|strong="H8127"\w*, and a \w foot|strong="H7272"\w* out of \w joint|strong="H4154"\w*.

\add As\add* he that taketh \w away|strong="H5710"\w* a \w garment|strong="H0899"\w* in \w cold|strong="H7135"\w* \w weather|strong="H3117"\w*, \add and as\add* \w vinegar|strong="H2558"\w* upon \w nitre|strong="H5427"\w*, so \add is\add* he that \w singeth|strong="H7891"\w* \w songs|strong="H7892"\w* to an \w heavy|strong="H7451"\w* \w heart|strong="H3820"\w*.

If thine \w enemy|strong="H8130"\w* be \w hungry|strong="H7457"\w*, give him \w bread|strong="H3899"\w* to \w eat|strong="H0398"\w*; and if he be \w thirsty|strong="H6771"\w*, give him \w water|strong="H4325"\w* to \w drink|strong="H8248"\w*:
For thou shalt \w heap|strong="H2846"\w* coals of \w fire|strong="H1513"\w* upon his \w head|strong="H7218"\w*, and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall \w reward|strong="H7999"\w* thee.

The \w north|strong="H6828"\w* \w wind|strong="H7307"\w* driveth \w away|strong="H2342"\w* \w rain|strong="H1653"\w*: so \add doth\add* an \w angry|strong="H2194"\w* \w countenance|strong="H6440"\w* a \w backbiting|strong="H5643"\w* \w tongue|strong="H3956"\w*.\f + \fr 25.23 \ft driveth…: or, bringeth forth rain: so doth a backbiting tongue an angry countenance\f*

\add It is\add* \w better|strong="H2896"\w* to \w dwell|strong="H3427"\w* in the \w corner|strong="H6438"\w* of the \w housetop|strong="H1406"\w*, than with a \w brawling|strong="H4079"\w* \w woman|strong="H0802"\w* and in a \w wide|strong="H2267"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*.

\add As\add* \w cold|strong="H7119"\w* \w waters|strong="H4325"\w* to a \w thirsty|strong="H5889"\w* \w soul|strong="H5315"\w*, so \add is\add* \w good|strong="H2896"\w* \w news|strong="H8052"\w* from a \w far|strong="H4801"\w* \w country|strong="H0776"\w*.

A \w righteous|strong="H6662"\w* man falling \w down|strong="H4131"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w wicked|strong="H7563"\w* \add is as\add* a \w troubled|strong="H7515"\w* \w fountain|strong="H4599"\w*, and a \w corrupt|strong="H7843"\w* \w spring|strong="H4726"\w*.

\add It is\add* not \w good|strong="H2896"\w* to \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* \w much|strong="H7235"\w* \w honey|strong="H1706"\w*: so \add for men\add* to \w search|strong="H2714"\w* their own \w glory|strong="H3519"\w* \add is not\add* \w glory|strong="H3519"\w*.

\w He|strong="H0376"\w* that \add hath\add* no \w rule|strong="H4623"\w* over his own \w spirit|strong="H7307"\w* \add is like\add* a \w city|strong="H5892"\w* \add that is\add* broken \w down|strong="H6555"\w*, \add and\add* without \w walls|strong="H2346"\w*.
